annotations.938: {"reasoning": "Let's work this out in a step by step way to be sure we have the right answer. The image shows a piece of dark chocolate ('chocolat noir') being held. Based on the size of the fingers holding it, the chocolate piece is approximately 6-7 cm long and 2-3 cm wide. Dark chocolate is dense, and a piece of this size typically weighs around 10-12 grams. Given the visible thickness and the standard density of dark chocolate, I estimate the weight of this piece to be 12 grams.", "chocolat noir": 12}
